title: Lady Eagles swoop into Top 25
text:
Lady Eagles swoop into Top 25 By Mike Tupa 
There’s only a handful of ‘firsts’ remaining for the Oklahoma Wesleyan University women’s soccer team. 
The Lady Eagles achieved one of them Tuesday afternoon. 
Following an anxious — and anticipation building — wait the previous two days, the OKWU women kept both eyes on this week’s NAIA Women’s Soccer Coaches Top 25 Poll. 
When it came out, the celebration began — for the first time in its history the Oklahoma Wesleyan Lady Eagles were ranked in the Top 25. 
They came in at No. 22, with 153 voting points, in the nation. 
The catalyst to the Lady Eagles’ historic ascension was last Saturday’s upset of Ottawa University, 2-1, in overtime. Ottawa (Kan.) had been ranked No. 18 going into that showdown. 
The OKWU Lady Eagles — who are coached by Vladan Glavonic — are 8-1-1 on the season and 3-0 in the Kansas Collegiate Athletic Conference. 
They are the lone KCAC team appearing in this week’s Top 25 poll. 
Conference members Ottawa and Kansas Wesleyan both appeared in the Others Receiving Votes list. 
Next up, the Lady Eagles are home tonight to take on Saint Mary. Starting time is 5 p.m. 
Eagles 
Although the Oklahoma Wesleyan University men’s soccer team is accustomed to being in the Top 25, the Eagles still felt a major boost by climbing in this week’s NAIA Men’s Soccer Coaches Top 25 Poll to No. 3 in the nation. 
The Eagles leapfrogged from No. 4 to No. 3 after last week’s No. 3-ranked Vanguard (Calif.) lost. 
The Eagles received 462 voting points, just 20 fewer than No. 2 Davenport and only 36 shy of top-ranked Rio Grande (Ohio). 
OKWU — which is coached by Jamie Peterson — is sitting at 10-1 overall and 3-0 in the KCAC. 
They have outscored their most recent four opponents by a total of 20-2. 
The Eagles are slated to be home at 7:30 p.m. tonight to face Saint Mary.
